title: Czołpino Lighthouse
text:
Czołpino Lighthouse (<a href="Polish%20language">Polish</a>: "Latarnia Morska Czołpino") is a lighthouse located on the <a href="Poland">Polish</a> coast of the <a href="Baltic%20Sea">Baltic Sea</a>, located to the north of the village of <a href="Czo%C5%82pino">Czołpino</a>, <a href="Pomeranian%20Voivodeship">Pomeranian Voivodeship</a>.
The lighthouse is located between <a href="Ustka">Ustka</a>'s and <a href="Osetnik%2C%20Pomeranian%20Voivodeship">Stilo</a>'s lighthouses.
History.
The <a href="lighthouse">lighthouse</a>'s construction was completed on 15 January 1875. On top of the tower, there is an optical device made in <a href="France">France</a>, from 1926. The lighthouse has a drum <a href="Lens%20%28optics%29">lens</a>, made from forty-three <a href="prism">prism</a>atic crystals.
